titles.title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to provide that individuals who are eligible to join the Armed Forces of the United States are also eligible to be security screening personnel.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Homeland Security.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Security, Infrastructure Protection, and Cybersecurity.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Security, Infrastructure Protection, and Cybersecurity
committee.name: House Homeland Security

bill.summary: 3/2/2006--Introduced. Amends federal aviation safety and security law to replace language requiring airport security screeners to be U.S. citizens with a provision that any individual eligible to join the U.S. armed forces is eligible to become a security screener.
